de.esoco.gwt.client.ui

Class LoginPanelManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<C>
      • de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerManager<C>

          • de.esoco.gwt.client.ui.LoginPanelManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.ewt.event.EwtEventHandler

    public class LoginPanelManager
extends PanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Panel,PanelManager<?,?>>
implements de.esoco.ewt.event.EwtEventHandler
    A panel manager implementation that displays and handles a login panel.

      • createLoginData

        protected de.esoco.data.element.StringDataElement createLoginData(java.lang.String sUserName,
                                                                  java.lang.String sPassword)
        Creates a new data element containing the login data. The default implementation creates a string data element with the user name as it's name and the password as it's value. It also adds the user info created by createLoginUserInfo() as a property with the property name AuthenticatedService.LOGIN_USER_INFO and an existing session ID (from the session cookie) with the property AuthenticatedService.SESSION_ID.
        Parameters:
        sUserName - The login user name
        sPassword - The login password
        Returns:
        The login data object

      • createLoginUserInfo

        protected java.lang.String createLoginUserInfo()
        Creates an information string for the user that is currently logging in.
        Returns:
        The user info string

      • handleLoginFailure

        protected void handleLoginFailure(java.lang.Throwable rCaught)
        Handles login failures. There are two ways this method can be invoked. This class first tries to connect to the server with user name and password set to NULL to check for an existing authentication. If that call fails the internal container builder reference will not be NULL and will be used to create the login components to query for the user login. The builder reference will then be set to NULL.
        Parameters:
        rCaught - The exception that occurred

      • handleLoginSuccess

        protected void handleLoginSuccess(de.esoco.data.element.DataElementList rUserData)
        Handles a successful authentication by invoking the login method LoginHandler.loginSuccessful(DataElementList).
        Parameters:
        rUserData - The user data instance returned by the service

      • login

        protected void login()
        Performs the login with the data from the input fields.

      • setUserNameCookie

        protected void setUserNameCookie(java.lang.String sUserName)
        Sets a cookie with the user name for re-use on subsequent logins. The expiration period of this cookie is 3 months.
        Parameters:
        sUserName - The user name to set
